item.title: Structure of Clinical Research
item.description: Clinical research is an essential part of practice of medicine. In short it is a project carried out by to investigate a research question - which should be focused on clinical aspect of medicine (i.e.Â the practice of medicine). Structure of the research is heavily dependant on the subject of interest. However, almost all studies follow a logical and focused organisation. A study has to have: Research question(s) Which needs to be FINER: feasible, interesting, novel, ethical and relevant Background and significance
